content:
jameysharp commented on issue #6327:

I think we might want a wildcard-audit for regalloc2 but I'm not sure what criteria @alexcrichton used for picking initial wildcard audits.

I'd also like to check with @elliottt and @cfallin about whether they have any concerns about the state of this RA2 release.

alexcrichton commented on issue #6327:

Oh no criteria, I mostly got tired of recertifying all the publishes! I think though a good criteria is "if your audit will be rubber-stamped may as well make it a wildcard audit". Or in other words for crates that we ourselves are authoring and publishing I think it's reasonable to have wildcard audits.

cfallin commented on issue #6327:

I'd also like to check with @elliottt and @cfallin about whether they have any concerns about the state of this RA2 release.

No concerns on my end at least -- @elliottt already upgraded us to 0.7.0 which was the bigger diff (no more special handling of program moves) and so this one should have no impact at all other than the stated one (new register class!).

elliottt commented on issue #6327:

We'll need to certify the RA2 bump in this PR as well, @afonso360 do you mind if I push a commit to this branch?

afonso360 commented on issue #6327:

We'll need to certify the RA2 bump in this PR as well, @afonso360 do you mind if I push a commit to this branch?

Sure, go ahead!
